question:
A company wants to use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) to run its on-premises application in a hybrid environment. The application currently runs on containers on premises.

The company needs a single container solution that can scale in an on-premises, hybrid, or cloud environment. The company must run new application containers in the AWS Cloud and must use a load balancer for HTTP traffic.

Which combination of actions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

options.A: Set up an ECS cluster that uses the AWS Fargate launch type for the cloud application containers. Use an Amazon ECS Anywhere external launch type for the on-premises application containers.
options.B: Set up an Application Load Balancer for cloud ECS services.
options.C: Set up a Network Load Balancer for cloud ECS services.
options.D: Set up an ECS cluster that uses the AWS Fargate launch type. Use Fargate for the cloud application containers and the on-premises application containers.
options.E: Set up an ECS cluster that uses the Amazon EC2 launch type for the cloud application containers. Use Amazon ECS Anywhere with an AWS Fargate launch type for the on-premises application containers.

explanation: ECS Anywhere with external launch type enables running containers on-premises while Fargate runs cloud containers. Application Load Balancer is appropriate for HTTP traffic. Fargate cannot run on-premises (only ECS Anywhere can).
